translation.text: The Primal, Immaculate Lord God is formless.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

translation.text: The Detached Lord is Himself prevailing in all.

text: ਵਰਨੁ ਜਾਤਿ ਚਿਹਨੁ ਨਹੀ ਕੋਈ ਸਭ ਹੁਕਮੇ ਸ੍ਰਿਸਟਿ ਉਪਾਇਦਾ ॥੧॥

translation.text: He has no race or social class, no identifying mark. By the Hukam of His Will, He created the entire universe. ||1||

transliteration.text: varan jāt chihan nahī kōī sabh hukamē srisat upāidā .1.

text: ਇਸੁ ਪਉੜੀ ਤੇ ਜੋ ਨਰੁ ਚੂਕੈ ਸੋ ਆਇ ਜਾਇ ਦੁਖੁ ਪਾਇਦਾ ॥੨॥

translation.text: That human who misses this chance, shall suffer the pains of coming and going in reincarnation. ||2||

transliteration.text: is paurī tē jō nar chūkai sō āi jāi dukh pāidā .2.

text: ਜਿਸੁ ਆਪਿ ਭੁਲਾਏ ਸੋਈ ਭੂਲੈ ਸੋ ਬੂਝੈ ਜਿਸਹਿ ਬੁਝਾਇਦਾ ॥੩॥

translation.text: He alone is confused, whom the Lord Himself confuses. He alone understands, whom the Lord inspires to understand. ||3||

transliteration.text: jis āp bhulāē sōī bhūlai sō būjhai jisah bujhāidā .3.

text: ਹਰਖ ਸੋਗ ਕਾ ਨਗਰੁ ਇਹੁ ਕੀਆ ॥

translation.text: This body has been made the village of joy and sorrow.

transliteration.text: harakh sōg kā nagar ih kīā .

text: ਤ੍ਰਿਹਾ ਗੁਣਾ ਤੇ ਰਹੈ ਨਿਰਾਰਾ ਸੋ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੋਭਾ ਪਾਇਦਾ ॥੪॥

translation.text: One who remains untouched by the three qualities, the three gunas - such a Gurmukh is blessed with glory. ||4||

transliteration.text: trihā gunā tē rahai nirārā sō guramukh sōbhā pāidā .4.

text: ਅਨਿਕ ਕਰਮ ਕੀਏ ਬਹੁਤੇਰੇ ॥ ਜੋ ਕੀਜੈ ਸੋ ਬੰਧਨੁ ਪੈਰੇ ॥

translation.text: You can do anything, but whatever you do, only serves to tie your feet.

transliteration.text: anik karam kīē bahutērē . jō kījai sō bandhan pairē .

text: ਕੁਰੁਤਾ ਬੀਜੁ ਬੀਜੇ ਨਹੀ ਜੰਮੈ ਸਭੁ ਲਾਹਾ ਮੂਲੁ ਗਵਾਇਦਾ ॥੫॥

translation.text: The seed which is planted out of season does not sprout, and all one's capital and profits are lost. ||5||

transliteration.text: kurutā bīj bījē nahī janmai sabh lāhā mūl gavāidā .5.

text: ਆਪਿ ਤਰੈ ਸਗਲੇ ਕੁਲ ਤਾਰੇ ਹਰਿ ਦਰਗਹ ਪਤਿ ਸਿਉ ਜਾਇਦਾ ॥੬॥

translation.text: You shall save yourself, and save all your generations as well. You shall go to the Court of the Lord with honor. ||6||

transliteration.text: āp tarai sagalē kul tārē har daragah pat siu jāidā .6.

text: ਸਭਿ ਕਾਲੈ ਵਸਿ ਆਪਿ ਪ੍ਰਭਿ ਕੀਆ ॥

translation.text: - God Himself has made them all subject to death.

transliteration.text: sabh kālai vas āp prabh kīā .

text: ਨਿਹਚਲੁ ਏਕੁ ਆਪਿ ਅਬਿਨਾਸੀ ਸੋ ਨਿਹਚਲੁ ਜੋ ਤਿਸਹਿ ਧਿਆਇਦਾ ॥੭॥

translation.text: The One Imperishable Lord Himself is unmoving and unchanging. Meditating on Him, one becomes unchanging. ||7||

transliteration.text: nihachal ēk āp abināsī sō nihachal jō tisah dhiāidā .7.

text: ਹਰਿ ਕਾ ਸੇਵਕੁ ਸੋ ਹਰਿ ਜੇਹਾ ॥

translation.text: The Lord's servant becomes like the Lord.

transliteration.text: har kā sēvak sō har jēhā .

text: ਜਿਉ ਜਲ ਤਰੰਗ ਉਠਹਿ ਬਹੁ ਭਾਤੀ ਫਿਰਿ ਸਲਲੈ ਸਲਲ ਸਮਾਇਦਾ ॥੮॥

translation.text: The waves of the water rise up in various ways, and then the water merges again in water. ||8||

transliteration.text: jiu jal tarang uthah bah bhātī phir salalai salal samāidā .8.

text: ਜਾ ਪ੍ਰਭ ਭਾਵੈ ਤਾ ਕਿਰਪਾ ਧਾਰੈ ॥

translation.text: When God pleases, He takes pity on him.

transliteration.text: jā prabh bhāvai tā kirapā dhārai .

text: ਦੇਹੁ ਦਰਸੁ ਜਿਤੁ ਮਨੁ ਤ੍ਰਿਪਤਾਸੈ ਹਰਿ ਕੀਰਤਨਿ ਮਨੁ ਠਹਰਾਇਦਾ ॥੯॥

translation.text: Please bless me with the Blessed Vision of Your Darshan, to satisfy my mind, O Lord. Through the Kirtan of Your Praises, my mind is held steady. ||9||

transliteration.text: dēh daras jit man tripatāsai har kīratan man thaharāidā .9.

text: ਰੂੜੋ ਠਾਕੁਰੁ ਕਿਤੈ ਵਸਿ ਨ ਆਵੈ ॥

translation.text: The Beauteous Lord and Master is not controlled in any way.

transliteration.text: rūrō thākur kitai vas n āvai .

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

text: ਹਰਿ ਸੋ ਕਿਛੁ ਕਰੇ ਜਿ ਹਰਿ ਕਿਆ ਸੰਤਾ ਭਾਵੈ ॥

translation.text: The Lord does that which pleases the Saints of the Lord.

transliteration.text: har sō kish karē j har kiā santā bhāvai .

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

text: ਕੀਤਾ ਲੋੜਨਿ ਸੋਈ ਕਰਾਇਨਿ ਦਰਿ ਫੇਰੁ ਨ ਕੋਈ ਪਾਇਦਾ ॥੧੦॥

translation.text: He does whatever they wish to be done; nothing blocks their way at His Door. ||10||

transliteration.text: kītā lōran sōī karāin dar phēr n kōī pāidā .10.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

text: ਜਿਥੈ ਅਉਘਟੁ ਆਇ ਬਨਤੁ ਹੈ ਪ੍ਰਾਣੀ ॥

translation.text: Wherever the mortal is confronted with difficulty,

transliteration.text: jithai aughat āi banat hai prānī .

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

translation.text: there he should meditate on the Lord of the Universe.

Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

text: ਜਿਥੈ ਪੁਤ੍ਰੁ ਕਲਤ੍ਰੁ ਨ ਬੇਲੀ ਕੋਈ ਤਿਥੈ ਹਰਿ ਆਪਿ ਛਡਾਇਦਾ ॥੧੧॥

translation.text: Where there are no children, spouse or friends, there the Lord Himself comes to the rescue. ||11||

transliteration.text: jithai putr kalatr n bēlī kōī tithai har āp shadāidā .11.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

translation.text: The Great Lord and Master is inaccessible and unfathomable.

translation.text: How can anyone meet with God, the self-suficient One?

text: ਕਾਟਿ ਸਿਲਕ ਜਿਸੁ ਮਾਰਗਿ ਪਾਏ ਸੋ ਵਿਚਿ ਸੰਗਤਿ ਵਾਸਾ ਪਾਇਦਾ ॥੧੨॥

translation.text: Those who have had the noose cut away from around their necks, whom God has set back upon the Path, obtain a place in the Sangat, the Congregation. ||12||

transliteration.text: kāt silak jis mārag pāē sō vich sangat vāsā pāidā .12.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. translation.text: One who realizes the Hukam of the Lord's Command is said to be His servant.

text: ਹਉਮੈ ਜਾਇ ਤ ਏਕੋ ਬੂਝੈ ਸੋ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸਹਜਿ ਸਮਾਇਦਾ ॥੧੩॥

translation.text: When egotism is silenced, then one comes to know the One Lord. Such a Gurmukh intuitively merges in the Lord. ||13||

transliteration.text: haumai jāi t ēkō būjhai sō guramukh sahaj samāidā .13.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. text: ਅਨਿਕ ਰੰਗ ਕਰਹਿ ਬਹੁ ਭਾਤੀ ਜਿਉ ਪਿਤਾ ਪੂਤੁ ਲਾਡਾਇਦਾ ॥੧੪॥

translation.text: They enjoy various pleasures in many ways; God caresses them, like a father caressing his son. ||14||

transliteration.text: anik rang karah bah bhātī jiu pitā pūt lādāidā .14.

text: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਪ੍ਰਗਟੁ ਭਇਆ ਤਿਨ ਜਨ ਕਉ ਜਿਨ ਧੁਰਿ ਮਸਤਕਿ ਲੇਖੁ ਲਿਖਾਇਦਾ ॥੧੫॥

translation.text: The Lord is revealed to those humble Gurmukhs, who have such pre-ordained destiny inscribed upon their foreheads. ||15||

transliteration.text: guramukh pragat bhaiā tin jan kau jin dhur masatak lēkh likhāidā .15.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. translation.text: You Yourself are the Creator Lord, the Cause of causes.

text: ਜਨ ਨਾਨਕੁ ਸਰਣਿ ਪਇਆ ਹਰਿ ਦੁਆਰੈ ਹਰਿ ਭਾਵੈ ਲਾਜ ਰਖਾਇਦਾ ॥੧੬॥੧॥੫॥

translation.text: Servant Nanak seeks the Sanctuary of Your Door, O Lord; if it is Your Will, please preserve his honor. ||16||1||5||

transliteration.text: jan nānak saran paiā har duārai har bhāvai lāj rakhāidā .16.1.5.
